page.title: 20ST.JAMES CHURCH HAMSTERLEY
page.content: The Church is late 13th century, formerly rectangular but now in the shape of a cross through the addition of the north and south transepts.There is a bellcote containing two bells. The church serves the parishes of Hamsterley,South Bedburn,Lynesack and Softley and has its own vicar.Apart from the Parochial Church Council the only body associated with the church is the Mothers' Union. The Vicar only recently took office but through his guidance has brought to fruition the installation of a new organ,electrification and a new heating system to replace the calor gas heaters. Services are held each Sunday at 8.00 10.30.and 6p.m.The estimated total attendance is 5% of the inhabitants. Annual social functions are the Christmas Fair and July Garden Party.
